fact_check_explanation_title: Mental health staff in the NHS
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of mental health doctors and nurses in the NHS has been falling.
Liaison psychiatry is available in nearly all A&Es in England. More than half of these are 24/7, but the extent of care provision still varies across them.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mental Health in England: Jeremy Hunt vs Ralf Little
fact_check_explanation_summary: The actor and the Health Secretary got into a dispute on Twitter over mental health services in England. We factchecked their claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mental health: staff working in talking therapies
fact_check_explanation_summary: Staff numbers working in the talking therapies programme for people with anxiety and depression have risen by at least 2,850 since 2012.
NHS England spent £11.6 billion on mental health in 2016/17.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are 40% of nurses leaving full-time work in their first year?
fact_check_explanation_summary: 15% of new full-time NHS England nurses left full-time work in the year May 2016 to May 2017. Overall, 41% of new nurses weren’t in full-time employment by May 2017.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can MPs breastfeed in the House of Commons?
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was ruled that breastfeeding was not allowed in the House of Commons Chamber and select committees in 2000, but a 2016 review has recommended changes.

fact_check_explanation_title: How much is spent on health and social care in the NHS?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Around 83% of English acute hospital trusts are in deficit so far this year. Social care spending has also fallen by £1.3 billion since 2010.

fact_check_explanation_title: What help is available for homeless people sleeping outside in cold weather?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Councils in England can take emergency measures to help rough sleepers during extreme weather.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many children are homeless in England, Scotland and Wales?
fact_check_explanation_summary: 128,000 children are living in temporary accommodation in Britain.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is house building at record levels?
fact_check_explanation_summary: 184,000 new homes were built in England in 2016/17, and there were 217,000 more homes added to the overall stock.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are 400,000 more children in absolute poverty since 2010?
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s not correct that absolute child poverty has risen by this much since 2010.
